metadata.title: CVE-2020-6750 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: GSocketClient in GNOME GLib through 2.62.4 may occasionally connectdirectly to a target address instead of connecting via a proxy server whenconfigured to do so, because the proxy_addr field is mishandled. This bugis timing-dependent and may occur only sporadically depending on networkdelays. The greatest security relevance is in use cases where a proxy isused to help with privacy/anonymity, even though there is no technicalbarrier to a direct connection. NOTE: versions before 2.60 are unaffected.

criterions.comment: glib2.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
